glite.user.name.description: Name of the user account used to run the gLite services on this LB node

glite.user.group.description: Group of the user specified in the 'glite.user.name' parameter. Leave it empty of comment it out to use the same as 'glite.user.name'

set.mysql.root.password.description: If this parameter is true, then the root password of the mysql database is set to the value specified in mysql.root.password if it not yet set. This parameter has no effect if the database root password is already set. It can be used to ease automated installation and configuration of the service, if mysql is not managed in some other way

lb.index.list.description: Definitions of indices on all the currently supported indexed system attributes

rgma.servicetool.enable.description: Publish log server via RGMA servicetool. If this variable is set to 'false': the other values of this instance are not taken into account.[Example: 'true'] [Type: 'boolean']

rgma.servicetool.service_type.description: The service type. This should be uniquely defined for each service type. The recommended format is the service namespace in reversed domain name format [Type: 'string']

rgma.servicetool.name.description: Name of the service. This should be globally unique. [Example: 'HOSTANME_LB_LocalLogger'] [Type: 'String']

rgma.servicetool.url_endpoint.description: URL to contact the service at. This should be unique for each service. Use example and adapt host. Example: http://your.host.name/LB/LBServer [Type: 'string']

rgma.servicetool.service_version.description: Service version in the form 'major.minor.patch' Example: 1.2.3 [Type: 'string']

rgma.servicetool.publish_interval.description: How often to check and publish service information. Example: 3600 [Type: 'string'] [Unit: 'seconds']

rgma.servicetool.status_script.description: Script to run when determining the service status. This script should return an exit code of 0 to indicate the service is OK, other values should indicate an error. The first line of the standard output should be a brief message describing the service status (e.g. 'Accepting connections') Example: ${GLITE_LOCATION}/etc/init.d/glite-lb-bkserverd status [Type: 'string']

rgma.servicetool.status_interval.description: How often to check and publish service status. Example: 60 [Type: 'string'] [Unit: 'seconds']

rgma.servicetool.url_wsdl.description: URL of a WSDL document for the service (leave blank if the service has no WSDL). Example: http://example.rl.ac.uk/service?WSDL [Type: 'string']

rgma.servicetool.url_semantics.description: URL of a document containing a detailed description of the service and how it should be used. Example: http://example.rl.ac.uk/service/semantics.html [Type: 'string']
